Gratz, Hyman. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside issued by the Board of Directors of the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts. Due to the fire of June 12th 1845, they are soliciting funds from the public and art from artists. Hyman Gratz, who was one of the founders, is listed as a Director
Greenbaum. New York, NY, Broadside for Greenebaum Bros. and Co., bankers
Greenberg, N. Lewiston, ME, Broadside for N. Greenberg done on wrapping paper
Greensfelder Bros. and Laupheimer. Baltimore, MD, Broadside from Greensfelder Bros. and Laupheimer with large list of cigars and prices, offering them for six months at no expense for "travelers"
Greil and Kohn. Selma, AL

Halevy, Fromental. New York, NY, Broadside for the famous opera, "The Jewess," at Ford Theater. The opera was written by Fromental Halévy. This late 1830's broadside is the earliest American existent for this famous opera and it may well be the only copy

Harby, Isaac and Cohen, E. P. Charleston, SC, Broadside transmitting the constitution of the Reformed Society of Israelites, with the printed signatures of Isaac Harby, D.M. Carvalho, Abraham Moise, E.P. Cohen, and Isaac N. Cardozo as the corresponding committee

Harby, Isaac and Isaacs, Hannah. New York, NY, Rare broadside for Isaac Harby's "Classical and English Academy" in New York City. It describes the cost and the format of education and is signed by Isaac Harby, who was both the owner and head master. It also has the signatures of Hannah Isaacs, Grace Isaacs and Montague Hendricks
Hart, Abraham. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside announcing the new rates for seats and rules of Mikveh Israel

Hays, Isaac. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside with an appeal on the behalf of the University of Pennsylvania Hospital to solicit endowment funds. On the reverse is a list of the officers of the Society of the Alumni of the Medical Deparment of the University of Pennsylvania
Hays, Samuel. Philadelphia, PA, Act empowering the Hebrew congregation known by the name and style of Kaal Kadosh Mikveh Israel to lease on ground rent a lot belonging to Mikveh Israel
Hess, Max. Allentown, PA, Broadside from the Hess Bros. for "bargain day."
Hirsh & Brothers. Lancaster, PA, Ad for Hirch and Brothers' "one price clothing house."
Hoffman, L. M. Brooklyn, NY, Ad for auction of New Orleans sugar
Hyman & Co. Cincinnati, OH, Broadside for the Seventh Season of YMHA's dramatic entertainment R Eureka Hall. The Bankers Daughter, with full listing of cast

Hyman, Israel. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside announcin a "Sheriff's sale," which is a public sale of a debtor's property by the local sheriff, as commanded by legal writ. The propery to be sold by the sheriff was seized and taken in execution from Israel Hyman
Imperial Cleaner. Philadelphia, PA, Advertisement for cleaning agent

Isaacs, Isaac A. Cleveland, OH, Advertisement for clothing at Union Hall
Isaacs, S. M. New York, NY, Printed letter from Rabbi S.M. Isaacs of the Shaary Tefilla, outlining the sums and donors to help the famished Jews in Palestine
J. B. Spelman. New York, NY, Ad in poem "Times are hard!" listing articles upon wwhich prices have been reduced
J. H. Cooper. , Advertisement for a gas regulator

Jackson, J. M., Jr. New York, NY, Selichoth Leymon Kippur, a single printed sheet with directions concerning the particular Penitential Prayers to be recited on Yom Kippur. Issued for Congregation Sha'are Tefilah, Franklin Street, New York City, all in Hebrew, 1847. Printed by Jacob Ben Solomon (J. M. Jackson Jr.)

Jackson, Solomon Henry. New York, NY, A printed address by Solomon Jackson (-1847) to Joseph Dreyfous, A.N. Phillips, and Montgomery Moses, on their report to the Society For the Education of the Poor Children and the relief of Indigent Persons of the Jewish Persuasion. This two page broadside was sent as stampless letter to T.I. Tobias in New York, New York

Judah, Mrs. San Francisco, CA, Theater broadside on silk for the "California Theatre Grand Testimonial!" Tendered to Ms. Judah, by the citizens of San Francisco and the entire dramatic and musical professions
Judah, Samuel N. and Tobias, Tobias I. New York, NY, Printed letter from the Committee of Congregation Shearith Israel searching for a teacher
Kakas Brothers. Boston, MA, Broadside from Kakas Brothers with printed price list for fur purchases
Kaufman, A. C. Charleston, SC, Quotation sheet for bonds, stocks, and coupons, issued weekly by A. C. Kaufman, banker and broker
Kirstein and Hambro. New York, NY, Advertisement of dresses with prices listed
Koch, H. C. F. New York, NY, Broadside ad on blue cardboard for H.C.F. Koch
Kolasky and Ober. New York, NY, Broadside for American Hair Works, with a printed list of different types of braids and imported hair
Kuhn & Co. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside for Kuhn and Co., with detailed two-sded list of prices

Lauer, Lewis and Lauer, Ignatius. Baltimore, MD, Broadside and invitation from the Directors of the Baltimore United Hebrew Assistance Society for a general meeting at Rechabite Hall. Giving notice that while the needs of poor increase, the membership at $3.00 per year decreases
Lazard, Freres. San Francisco, CA, Ad announcing the movement of the Lazard Bros. dry goods store
Lazarus, Harry. Tompkinsville, KY, Broadside from Harry Lazarus advertising his desire to buy mules and horses

Lazarus, Joshua. Charleston, SC, Broadside stating the terms upon which the public will be supplied with gas by the Charleston Gas Light Company, signed by Joshua Lazarus (1791-1861), president and founder of the Charleston Gas Light Co., and president of the Kahal Kadosh Beth Elohim Synagogue

Leeser, Isaac and Goldstein, Isaac. New York, NY, Acrostic broadside of the death of Isaac Leeser in English and in Hebrew, made by Isaac Goldstein. It includes a lithograph of Leeser, and was printed by J. Davis

Leeser, Isaac and Wise, Isaac Mayer. Philadelphia, PA, A printed letter from Isaac Leeser, Isaac Mayer Wise, and Dr. Lilienthal, calling for a national meeting of Jewish leaders to address the various ills of Judaism in the United States. It asks that all congregations respond to Leeser, as secretary. This was the first known attempt have a national meeting on the ills of Judaism in United States
Leeser, Isaac. Philadelphia, PA, Circular broadside announcing the formation of the American Jweish Publication Society, issued by Isaac Leeser as the corresponding secretary
Leeser, Issac. Philadelphia, PA, A dated subscription form issued by Isaac Leeser, advising that he has completed his eight "volume" and is still publishing
Lehman, H. and Wertheim, Carrie. New York, NY, Broadside with detailed price list for furs and "Aunt Carrie's rheumkeene," manufactured by Carrie Wertheim and distributed by H. Lehman, furrier

Levy, Benjamin. New Orleans, LA, A broadside for "Levy's current letter sheet prices," printed by Benjamin Levy (1786-1860), the first Jewish printer in America

Levy, Jacob. Easton, PA, Broadside announcing the opening of a new store for men's and boys' clothing by Jacob Levy

Levy, Jonas Phillips. Washington, DC, A printed broadside for "The memorial fo Capt. Jonas Levy, who transported troops in the Battle of Vera Cruz, as the captain of the "American". On both sides, details of his claims and losses are listed
Levy, S. Nashville, TN, Broadside on a postcard from the Porter National Detective Agency, offering a $50 reward for S. Levy, a polish jew, wanted for grand larceny
Levy, Uriah P. and Levy, Jonas Phillips. New York, NY
Levy. Portland, ME, Broadside advertising Professor Levy, a traveling optician and oculist

Mayer, Elias. Cincinnati, OH, A hand out on a steamship for visitors to Cincinnati, Ohio, soliciting their purchases at various wholesale merchants, manufacturers, and artisans, including Elias Mayer, wholesale clothier
Meyer's. Boston, MA, Broadside with graphic of Meyer's store

Mickve Israel. Philadelphia, PA, For the relief of Jews who fled to Gibraltar from the brutality of the lawless Moorish Kabyle. Broadside was from a committee formed to solicit funds from the members of Mikveh Israel in Philadelphia. It includes a letter by Montifiore, and lists the members with addresses

Myers, Mordecai and Meyers, W. B. Galesburg, IL, Notification that the North American Land Agency, established by Maj. M. Myers in 1817, have been moved from New York City to Galesburg, Illinois
Nathans & Co. Providence, R. I., Advertisement for tailors
Nathans, David. Philadelphia, PA, Outlines the revised rules for the purchasers of the honors for the dedication of the new temple
Newburg and Rosenburg. Congers, NY, Broadside celebrating the opening of the lower factory of Newburg and Rosenburg
Noah, Mordecai Manuel. New York, NY, Playbill of "Yusef Caramalli, or the Seige of Tripoli" written by Mordecai M. Noah and performed at Park Theatre in New York City. Only known copy

Nones, Joseph B. New York, NY, Pronted broadside of Joseph B. Nones (1797-1887), listing the 37 states, Canada, Biritsh Indies, and French possessions where he is a noraty public. It outlines that he may issues passports, protections, and various other legal documents. The broadside is attached to his letter to the Secretary of State of Iowa asking for the renewal of his commission
Numerous. New York, List of peddlers licensed to sell foreign goods in New York with numerous Jewish names

Numerous. Philadelphia, PA, Approval form for individual organizations to become part of "The Society of the United Hebrew Charities of Philadelphia", formed in 1901 with Jacob Gimbel as its first president. Forerunner to 20th century federations
Numerous. Philadelphia, PA, Circular announcing a special meeting of Mikveh Israel to enact bylaws on the burial grounds and rules of internment

Numerous. Rochester, NY, "Semi-Annual Public Exercises of the Hebrew Institute" songs of no religious nature listing Rev. I. Mayer as Principal of the Hebrew and Jewish Departments. Published by Adolph Nolte and marks the early years of the Jewish community in Rochester, NY

Oppenheimer, Samuel. Vienna, Austria, Imperial edict by Leopold I directing people to pay their debts to Samuel Oppenheim, as well as to his sons and other relatives. The payments are to be in three installments over six months. It was issued on 11/19/1690 and reconfirmed in this document on 4/30/1700

Patman, J. and Stein, A. Philadelphia, PA, Printed invitation to the consecration of the "Seekers of Peace" Congregation. It is printed on a stampless envelope adress to P. D. Vroom in New Jersey and is signed by Rabbi Kahn

Peixotto, Daniel L. M. New York, NY, Notice from a committee of five physicians, including Daniel L. M. Peizotto, who served as president of the New York Medical Society from 1830-1832, concerning attempts in the American medical community to bring professional integrity and standards to American medicine

Philips, Henry, Jr. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside for the Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia with Henry Philips Jr., archeologist and numismatist, listed as the Corresponding Secretary and the Chairperson of the Numismatics Committee

Phillips, I. J. and Pesoa, David. Philadelphia, PA, Printed letter offering $200 for a design and cost estimate for the new K.K. Mikveh Israel, to be built in the lot of Arch Street above Tenth in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is signed in proof by the building committee

Phillips, J. A. and Pesoa, D. Philadelphia, PA, A printed letter from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania outlining the new rates for the K.K. Mikveh Israel. It apologizes for the higher rates due to new building, and lists the board members
Phillips, N. New York, NY, Printed letter by N. Phillips, as clerk of Shearith Israel in New York City, notifying that no one who married out of the faith may join
Phillips, Sophia. Philadelphia, PA, Poster for the famous Philadelphia Chestnut St. Theatre announcing Miss Sophia Phillips, the celebrated actress, in the tragedy, "The Gamester"

Phillips, Z. Philadelphia, PA, Printed letter from the Board of Managers of K. K. Mickve Israel extracting their minutes and outlining the financial responsibilities of members and rights of the Mickve Israel to go after bad debts
Pitkin. Philadelphia, PA, Advertising brochure in original envelope for an early Army Navy store, Pitkin and Co. of Philadelphia

Putzel, S. G. and Lauer, Lewis. Baltimore, MD, Printed letter to the members of Baltimore United Hebrew Assistance Society, announcing a meeting to raise funds, addressed to Dr. J. Cohen, a well known scientist and doctor

Raphall, Morris Jacob. Baltimore, MD, "A Course of Six Popular Lectures on the Poetry of the Hebrews" by Rev. Morris J. Raphall, preacher at the Synagogue in Birmingham, England with handwritten notes. Found among the papers of Rev. Isaac Leeser
Reuben and Rosenberger. New York, NY, Broadside with price list and illustrated with garments
Robinson. Louisville, KY, Printed letter and offerings of spring imports. May not be Jewish
Rosenbaum. Reading, PA, Broadside for Rosenbaum's Star Clothing House
Rosenwald's. Albuquerque, NM, Broadside for Rosenwald's with illustrations with prices of goodyear rubbers for high buckel shoes with shoe size chart on reverse
Sailer, Isaac D. Philadelphia, PA, Envelope with price list for Jack Brand and Queen Brand, price list with graphics on page 4, price list of 10 combination orders of Isaac D. Sailer
Sailer, Isaac D. Philadelphia, PA, Envelope with return envelope inside with a price booklet of cigars

Shoyer, G. Philadelphia, PA, Price list for fur skins, listing a house cat
Silverberg, A. Brooklyn, NY, Ad for custom suits and cleaning by The London Tailoring Co
Simon, Sam. Oberlin, OH, Special offer for rags at two cents a pound
Simons, H. and Dreyfous, H. New York, NY, Mrs. H. Simon's broadside announcing the opening of private Jewish female boarding school listing courses, teachers and costs
Stein's Drug Store. Reading, PA, Broadside with the heading "to farmers" describing drugs and including a corresponding price list

Ulmann, Bernhard. New York, NY

Unknown. Braunschweig, Germany, Rare broadside to put on the wall to inform the crowd of Braunschweig that Jews are nont allowed to buy, to deal or to export silver with the threat to confiscate all the silver from the Jews. Context for Jews, like Gratz, who fled to America for economic freedom
Unknown. Germany, Printing of the prayer El Melekh Yoshev

Unknown. Portsmouth, NH, Circular addressed to the Reverend and the Clergy of All Denominations for aid for funds to recover from the Great Fire of December 24, 1806. It may be the first public appeal to truly all religions including Jews
Unknown. Rochester, NY, Invitation of The Hebrew Shelter (Hachnosas Orchim) of Rochester to the grand opening of their new building in Yiddish and English

did.unittitle: Benjamin, Judah P. New Orleans, LA, Early legal brief by Judah P. Benjamin (age 27) dealing with "Slave Law". Court document is penned and signed by Judah P. Benjamin in New Orleans, Louisiana on February 10th, 1838
Benjamin, Judah P. New Orleans, LA, Important legal brief by Judah P. Benjamin dealing with the "Slave Law". Signed by Judah P. Benjamin in New Orleans, Louisiana in 1835
Benjamin, Judah P. New Orleans, LA, Judah P. Benjamin is a surety for John Hall as principal for $1200 in New Orleans, Louisiana on February 13th, 1838. Signed by Judah P. Benjamin

Benzaken, Eleazer and Simons, Solomon. New York, NY, Arrest warrant for Eleazer Benzaken and Solomon Simons, signed by M. Willet as sheriff, and Richard Morris as Chief Justice of the New York Supreme Court

Berliner, Rosa. Baltimore, MD, Unusual legal document in which a woman, Rosa Berliner, is appointed Trustee to her husband. Signed and sealed by Rosa Berliner, Louis Frank, Isabella Weinman, Emanuel Weinman, and Edward Dowling, court clerk
Blum, Nathan. Washington, DC, Warrant for the arrest of Thomas Meekins and Richard Carter, signed by William Tucker
Cardoza, Albert. New York, NY, James Fisks railroad related case, signed by Albert Cardoza, New York state supreme court justice
Cardoza, Albert. New York, NY, James Fisks railroad related case, signed by Albert Cardoza, New York state supreme court justice
Cardoza, Albert. New York, NY, James Fisks railroad related case, signed by Albert Cardoza, New York state supreme court justice

Cardozo and Lazarus, Michael. Charleston, SC, Hand written report from a rail road lawyer to the President of the South Western Rail Road Bank naming each person, the date a judgment was obtained against him, and the amount of the verdict

Cohen Jr., Jacob I. Baltimore, MD, Group of three documents, from Baltimore, Maryland, dated September, 1861, all pertaining to a lawsuit brought by Thomas Phillips against Jacob I. Cohen, Jr., in which Phillips sues over $2500 worth of store merchandise and fixtures
Cohen, David Daniel. Charleston, SC, Land transaction of David Daniel Cohen selling land from his plantation known as Soliders' Retreat
Cohen, H. Philadelphia, PA, Claim filed by the M.M. Marple Company of Philadelphia against the estate of one H. Cohen (Deceased)
Cohen, Magnus and Cohen, Arnoleine. Baltimore, MD, Offical documents for travel from Hanover, Germany to Baltimore, Maryland
Cohen, N. A. Pasquotank County, NC, 158 year old document of arrest from Pasquotank County. Samuel Meads is being arrested for a $1.00 debt owed N.A. Cohen
Cohen, Nathan A. Charleston, SC, Court record of a civil case brought by the bank of the state of South Carolina
Cohen, Nathan A. Charleston, SC, This document is a mortgage dispute agains Nathan A. Cohen, twice signed by James Simons, a brigadier general in the South Carolina Militia
